text: at faculty we're an artificial
intelligence company based in London we
built our platform faculty platform to
run on AWS
it's a toolkit for AI practitioners so
the data scientists it allows them to
build and train and deploy machine
learning models collaboratively and at
scale we chose AWS for a couple of
reasons
firstly we go where our customers are
the other one is around security we deal
with a lot of sensitive data we want to
make sure that it's secure and AWS
provides lots of great services around
security one example our collaboration
with the UK home office that we've been
working with them to help automatically
detect online terrorist propaganda
material that's a tricky task and
requires a lot of computational so a lot
of data storage AWS has been central to
the algorithms that we've trained that
can now detect very accurately this
propaganda material one of the key
benefits has been not to worry about
building infrastructure also running it
in production environments AWS handles a
lot of that for us which means that we
can focus on actually making our product
better and building and deploying new
features which is great good example for
us is the alias service that's a network
file share that scales dynamically we've
been using that to give data scientists
a collaborative workspace and they've
been able to process hundreds of
terabytes of data using that technology
AWS has made our job easier especially
around explain ability and AI safety
being able to go a level deeper into AI
model and be able to understand how it's
working talk to peers and colleagues on
encourage them to use AWS the services
are great the partner network and the
support that you get from like account
managers is fantastic AWS has got
ridiculous scale and we were able to
leverage that which has been going to be
also
you
